alert.note: Alert for Colfax (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 8:31AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast New Mexico, including the following county, Colfax. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 828 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving northeast across the area between Raton and Sugarite Canyon State Park. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen since 7 am and between 1 and 3 inches was reported from overnight. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chicorica Creek, State Roads 72, 193, and 526, portions of U.S. Highway 64/87, and Johnson Park Road. - This includes the following highways... Highway 64 between Mile Markers 340 and 344...and between Mile Markers 351 and 364. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 443 and 449. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
